<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>As a company dedicated to bringing you daily news, we’re not typically known for keeping secrets. But...we have been keeping a pretty big one. Today we're launching Marketing Brew. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three times a week, we’ll be delivering the most important news in the marketing industry—curated, distilled, and written with typical Brew flair. If you work in the sector, this will be a must-read for you and your colleagues.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The first edition hits inboxes in just a few hours, so <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/marketing/?utm_source=daily&utm_medium=mkb&utm_campaign=link" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sign up</a> to get Marketing Brew today. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REOPENING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/28/controversy-masks-threatens-us-pandemic-response?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Masks: A More Controversial Accessory Than Croc Charms
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Face mask requirement" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTI1L2ZhY2VfbWFza19yZXF1aXJlbWVudC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>John Paraskevas/Newsday via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Gotten into an argument with a stranger recently? Here's a guess—it was because one of you wasn’t wearing a mask.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As coronavirus cases jump in the U.S., a small piece of fabric has become a hot-button issue across politics, business, and health. And the conversation is only growing more heated.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What are leaders saying? </strong>Yesterday, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi <a href="https://www.axios.com/pelosi-face-mask-coronavirus-5dc8ae4b-412e-49ad-bb30-21b362b9df86.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> a national mask mandate is “long overdue.” Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell <a href="https://www.courier-journal.com/story/news/politics/2020/06/26/mitch-mcconnell-urges-people-wear-masks-until-theres-covid-19-vaccine/3266655001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">emphasized</a> on Friday that Americans should wear masks in public. Joe Biden <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/26/politics/joe-biden-masks-mandatory-coronavirus/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> he’d make them compulsory if elected. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">President Trump, however, has <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/transcript-of-president-trumps-interview-with-the-wall-street-journal-11592501000?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">called</a> masks a "double-edged sword" and doesn’t wear them in public. VP Mike Pence encouraged Americans to wear masks in affected areas, but said the White House <a href="https://thehill.com/homenews/sunday-talk-shows/504909-pence-we-want-to-defer-to-local-officials-on-requiring-masks?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will continue to</a> “defer to governors” about setting policies.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">When you let states decide...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You get a fragmented approach. 21 states have some form of public mask <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/26/coronavirus-mask-mandates-differ-across-the-country-as-hot-spots-multiply.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">requirement</a>, per CNBC research. Which means 29 don't...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nebraska threatened to cut off counties from COVID-19 relief if they pass mask mandates. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Texas Gov. Greg Abbott has </span><span><a href="https://www.texastribune.org/2020/06/20/face-mask-order-dallas-harris-travis-bexar/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span>, "Government cannot require individuals to wear masks...local governments can require stores and business to require masks." </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why the controversy? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Studies show mask mandates help <a href="https://www.axios.com/coronavirus-face-mask-science-e9df446b-e7fb-447b-a980-67a9cf73556a.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosscience&stream=science&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reduce the spread</a> of COVID-19—even a simple cloth mask cuts transmission 10%. Another study revealed that countries with policies and norms more favorable to mask-wearing had lower coronavirus death rates. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But some Americans have called mask mandates an infringement on their individual liberties, which has led to chaotic scenes in <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2020/06/27/mask-requirement-trader-joes-viral-twitter-video/3271625001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grocery stores</a> and <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/18/us/american-airlines-mask-brandon-straka.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">airplanes</a> as a result of customers who don't comply. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Plot twist:</strong></span><span> It’s not just the U.S.—European countries also have </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/masks-could-help-stop-coronavirus-so-why-are-they-still-controversial-11593336601?mod=mhp&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lower acceptance</a></span><span> of masks, a study by Germany's University of Bamberg shows.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The situation leaves businesses and their employees the stressful job of refereeing mask-wearing. Yesterday, one LA-area taco stand <a href="https://twitter.com/hugostacos/status/1277267379425288197?s=12&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">temporarily closed</a> locations after employees faced verbal and physical harassment by angry customers who refused to don masks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Mask squabbles show just <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2020/06/25/face-masks-america-divided/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">how political</a> America’s pandemic response has become, and companies are caught in the crosshairs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Learn more: </strong>We wrote about the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/02/masks-prove-puzzling-new-retail-category?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">future of face masks</a> as a retail category. Tl;dr...no one really knows what's going to happen.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/28/boeing-737-max-expected-begin-critical-test-flights-monday?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
737 Max Enters Phase 1 of Its Reopening
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you see a plane doing lazy passes over Seattle today, it’s not the Patriots filming Seahawks practice—it's the Boeing 737 Max on its <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-53212274?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first certification flight</a> since being grounded 15 months ago.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The test flights, which are expected to start today and last for three days, represent a key milestone in getting the Max back into the air.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>All 737 Maxes have been parked since March 2019 following two fatal crashes that killed 346 people. Boeing has suffered a severe financial and reputational crisis as a result—the 737 Max was its best-selling aircraft. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In January, Boeing said costs associated with the 737 Max grounding will add up to </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/business/boeing-737-max-costs.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than $18 billion</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So what’s the point of the test flights? </strong>Pilots from Boeing and the Federal Aviation Administration will be doing various flight maneuvers and intentionally triggering the automated stall-prevention software system that malfunctioned in both crashes, <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-boeing-737-max-exclusive/exclusive-boeing-737-max-certification-flight-tests-to-begin-on-monday-sources-idUSKBN23Z040?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Reuters writes</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>even if it aces these certification flights, the 737 Max has months to go before it’s back in the skies. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/28/chesapeake-energy-files-chapter-11-bankruptcy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We’re Far From the Shale-ow Now
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Chesapeake Energy <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/fracking-trailblazer-chesapeake-energy-files-for-bankruptcy-11593374287?mod=breakingnews&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed for bankruptcy</a> yesterday, and if you’ve never heard of this company before...the things you are about to read will blow your mind. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s start at the beginning. Chesapeake was cofounded and led by a character named Aubrey McClendon, who saw the promise of horizontal drilling and hydraulic fracturing (fracking) and gobbled up land for oil and gas exploration. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then came fantastic growth...and fantastic debt.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In the early 2010s, Chesapeake </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/28/business/economy/chesapeake-energy-bankruptcy.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spent</a></span><span> about $30 billion </span><span><em>more </em></span><span>on leasing and drilling than it earned in revenue from energy production, the NYT writes. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In 2012, Chesapeake’s market value was 1/27th the size of Exxon’s, but its net debt load was </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-12/chesapeake-s-demise-marks-end-of-shale-model-that-changed-world?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">double</a></span><span>, per Bloomberg’s calculations.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">McClendon was forced out in 2013 after accumulating more than $20 billion in debt. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Fast forward to 2020...</strong>the coronavirus and ensuing lockdowns caused a crash in oil and gas prices, and Chesapeake reported a more than $8 billion loss in Q1.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>“The COVID-19-driven collapse in world energy prices merely added one more exclamation point to a tale of risk, hubris, and debt,” Bloomberg writes.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY THE MOTLEY FOOL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Final Chapter in Our Investing Saga
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/04/ultimate-guide-investing-today-tomorrow-beyond#story6" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="The Motley Fool" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMjk3LzE1OTE4MDE2NTctR2V0dHlJbWFnZXMtMTAzMjU2MTcyMC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As you may have noticed recently, we’ve been pumping a lot of brain power into creating “<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/04/ultimate-guide-investing-today-tomorrow-beyond" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Ultimate Guide to Investing</a>” with our stock-guru friends at The Motley Fool.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, other friends, the <strong style="color:#000">sixth and final installment of that guide is </strong><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/04/ultimate-guide-investing-today-tomorrow-beyond#story6" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">finally here</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In this <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/04/ultimate-guide-investing-today-tomorrow-beyond#story6" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closing piece</a>, we break down what you should think about when investing on a budget and how even a little can go a long way.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’re super clever and titled it “<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/04/ultimate-guide-investing-today-tomorrow-beyond#story6" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">A Little Goes a Long Way: Investing on a Budget</a>.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For those hearing of this guide for the first time, check out the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/04/ultimate-guide-investing-today-tomorrow-beyond" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">full feature</a>—it’s packed with all sorts of helpful insights from The Fools of The Motley Fool, including thoughts on the current market and how to diversify your portfolio.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Read, absorb, and cherish the entire guide <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/04/ultimate-guide-investing-today-tomorrow-beyond" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">right here</a>.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ADVERTISING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/28/starbucks-pauses-ads-social-media?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
This Boycott Just Got a Caffeine Shot
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Looks like Zuck is joining team Dunkin’. In a stand against hate speech, Starbucks announced it’s <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2020/06/28/facebook-ad-boycott-starbucks-pausing-advertising-social-media-platforms/3274467001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pausing</a> advertising on social media platforms—including Facebook, the recent subject of a boycott by nearly 100 brands. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There’s a reason we’re giving Starbucks the spotlight: The coffee chain <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/26/business/media/Facebook-advertising-boycott.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spent</a> almost $95 million on Facebook last year, making it the platform’s sixth-largest advertiser, per Pathmatics.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before you prep Facebook’s obituary...know that just 6% of the platform's 2019 ad revenue came from its 100 biggest spenders. So while Zuck lost his whales, like any good pit boss he knows the money’s in the slots. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Which, in this case, are the small- and mid-sized businesses that make up the vast majority of Facebook’s 8 million advertisers. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“It would likely take tens of thousands of them, acting over a significant period of time, to put a big dent in Facebook's bottom line,” CNN </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/26/tech/facebook-boycott/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the boycott runs through July, the start of Q3, so we won’t know the financial impact until later this year. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>July begins; USMCA trade deal goes into effect; Canada Day; MLB players report to camp; earnings (Constellation Brands; General Mills)</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Helmed by our very own marketing maven, Phoebe Bain, Marketing Brew will be a 3x a week, in-depth look at everything from ad tech to campaign executions to platform revolutions. And just to reiterate, there will of course be GIFs. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Start Talking
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>On Mondays, we're going to present some of the thorniest business topics of the day, give you a jumping-off point with balanced resources, and encourage you to debate it with friends, family, and coworkers. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Today’s prompt: </strong>On Friday, the Fed <a href="https://www.bankingdive.com/news/fed-suspend-share-buybacks-cap-dividends/580644/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ordered</a> banks to suspend share buybacks in Q3 (which, granted, many of the largest banks already promised to do through next spring). The practice of share buybacks has generated criticism in recent years, including earlier this spring when the <a href="https://www.vox.com/2020/3/21/21189471/stock-buybacks-coronavirus-bailouts-airlines-trump?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">airline industry</a> sought a massive government bailout. </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>What’s a share buyback? (</span><span><a href="https://www.investopedia.com/articles/02/041702.asp?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Investopedia</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A quick video discussing whether buybacks help or hurt the economy (</span><span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EDyvkbwR6Uw&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Why the coronavirus pandemic has put a stop to many buybacks (</span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/05/populism-worked-on-buybacks-but-can-bull-market-without-them-last.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CNBC</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Warren Buffett explains buybacks (</span><span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cHE8buzL3Ag&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">YouTube</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>An argument against punishing companies for buybacks (</span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/opinion/coronavirus-bailout-dont-punish-companies-for-stock-buybacks?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Washington Examiner</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>There’s also been some controversy around insider trading (</span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/15/practice-selling-buybacks-comes-fire?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Morning Brew</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Once you’ve dug through the articles/videos, hit reply and let us know how your digging went. Are you in favor of limiting buybacks?</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nMasks: A More Controversial Accessory Than Croc Charms\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Face mask requirement\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGotten into an argument with a stranger recently? Here's a guess—it was because one of you wasn’t wearing a mask.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs coronavirus cases jump in the U.S., a small piece of fabric has become a hot-button issue across politics, business, and health. And the conversation is only growing more heated.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat are leaders saying? \u003c/strong\u003eYesterday, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/pelosi-face-mask-coronavirus-5dc8ae4b-412e-49ad-bb30-21b362b9df86.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e a national mask mandate is “long overdue.” Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell \u003ca href=\"https://www.courier-journal.com/story/news/politics/2020/06/26/mitch-mcconnell-urges-people-wear-masks-until-theres-covid-19-vaccine/3266655001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eemphasized\u003c/a\u003e on Friday that Americans should wear masks in public. Joe Biden \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/26/politics/joe-biden-masks-mandatory-coronavirus/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e he’d make them compulsory if elected. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePresident Trump, however, has \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/transcript-of-president-trumps-interview-with-the-wall-street-journal-11592501000?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalled\u003c/a\u003e masks a \"double-edged sword\" and doesn’t wear them in public. VP Mike Pence encouraged Americans to wear masks in affected areas, but said the White House \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/homenews/sunday-talk-shows/504909-pence-we-want-to-defer-to-local-officials-on-requiring-masks?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill continue to\u003c/a\u003e “defer to governors” about setting policies.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhen you let states decide...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou get a fragmented approach. 21 states have some form of public mask \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/26/coronavirus-mask-mandates-differ-across-the-country-as-hot-spots-multiply.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erequirement\u003c/a\u003e, per CNBC research. Which means 29 don't...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNebraska threatened to cut off counties from COVID-19 relief if they pass mask mandates. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTexas Gov. Greg Abbott has \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.texastribune.org/2020/06/20/face-mask-order-dallas-harris-travis-bexar/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, \"Government cannot require individuals to wear masks...local governments can require stores and business to require masks.\" \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy the controversy? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStudies show mask mandates help \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/coronavirus-face-mask-science-e9df446b-e7fb-447b-a980-67a9cf73556a.html?utm_source=newsletter\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosscience\u0026stream=science\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereduce the spread\u003c/a\u003e of COVID-19—even a simple cloth mask cuts transmission 10%. Another study revealed that countries with policies and norms more favorable to mask-wearing had lower coronavirus death rates. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut some Americans have called mask mandates an infringement on their individual liberties, which has led to chaotic scenes in \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2020/06/27/mask-requirement-trader-joes-viral-twitter-video/3271625001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egrocery stores\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/18/us/american-airlines-mask-brandon-straka.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eairplanes\u003c/a\u003e as a result of customers who don't comply. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePlot twist:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e It’s not just the U.S.—European countries also have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/masks-could-help-stop-coronavirus-so-why-are-they-still-controversial-11593336601?mod=mhp\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elower acceptance\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of masks, a study by Germany's University of Bamberg shows.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe situation leaves businesses and their employees the stressful job of refereeing mask-wearing. Yesterday, one LA-area taco stand \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/hugostacos/status/1277267379425288197?s=12\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etemporarily closed\u003c/a\u003e locations after employees faced verbal and physical harassment by angry customers who refused to don masks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eMask squabbles show just \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2020/06/25/face-masks-america-divided/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehow political\u003c/a\u003e America’s pandemic response has become, and companies are caught in the crosshairs.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Learn more: \u003c/strong\u003eWe wrote about the \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/02/masks-prove-puzzling-new-retail-category?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efuture of face masks\u003c/a\u003e as a retail category. Tl;dr...no one really knows what's going to happen.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you see a plane doing lazy passes over Seattle today, it’s not the Patriots filming Seahawks practice—it's the Boeing 737 Max on its \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/business-53212274?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst certification flight\u003c/a\u003e since being grounded 15 months ago.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe test flights, which are expected to start today and last for three days, represent a key milestone in getting the Max back into the air.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAll 737 Maxes have been parked since March 2019 following two fatal crashes that killed 346 people. Boeing has suffered a severe financial and reputational crisis as a result—the 737 Max was its best-selling aircraft. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn January, Boeing said costs associated with the 737 Max grounding will add up to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/business/boeing-737-max-costs.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than $18 billion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo what’s the point of the test flights? \u003c/strong\u003ePilots from Boeing and the Federal Aviation Administration will be doing various flight maneuvers and intentionally triggering the automated stall-prevention software system that malfunctioned in both crashes, \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-boeing-737-max-exclusive/exclusive-boeing-737-max-certification-flight-tests-to-begin-on-monday-sources-idUSKBN23Z040?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eReuters writes\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eeven if it aces these certification flights, the 737 Max has months to go before it’s back in the skies. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/fracking-trailblazer-chesapeake-energy-files-for-bankruptcy-11593374287?mod=breakingnews\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" things you are about to read will blow your mind. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLet’s start at the beginning. Chesapeake was cofounded and led by a character named Aubrey McClendon, who saw the promise of horizontal drilling and hydraulic fracturing (fracking) and gobbled up land for oil and gas exploration. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThen came fantastic growth...and fantastic debt.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn the early 2010s, Chesapeake \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/28/business/economy/chesapeake-energy-bankruptcy.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espent\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e about $30 billion \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003emore \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eon leasing and drilling than it earned in revenue from energy production, the NYT writes. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn 2012, Chesapeake’s market value was 1/27th the size of Exxon’s, but its net debt load was \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-12/chesapeake-s-demise-marks-end-of-shale-model-that-changed-world?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edouble\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, per Bloomberg’s calculations.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMcClendon was forced out in 2013 after accumulating more than $20 billion in debt. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFast forward to 2020...\u003c/strong\u003ethe coronavirus and ensuing lockdowns caused a crash in oil and gas prices, and Chesapeake reported a more than $8 billion loss in Q1.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003e“The COVID-19-driven collapse in world energy prices merely added Shot\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLooks like Zuck is joining team Dunkin’. In a stand against hate speech, Starbucks announced it’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2020/06/28/facebook-ad-boycott-starbucks-pausing-advertising-social-media-platforms/3274467001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epausing\u003c/a\u003e advertising on social media platforms—including Facebook, the recent subject of a boycott by nearly 100 brands. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere’s a reason we’re giving Starbucks the spotlight: The coffee chain \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/26/business/media/Facebook-advertising-boycott.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espent\u003c/a\u003e almost $95 million on Facebook last year, making it the platform’s sixth-largest advertiser, per Pathmatics.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBefore you prep Facebook’s obituary...know that just 6% of the platform's 2019 ad revenue came from its 100 biggest spenders. So while Zuck lost his whales, like any good pit boss he knows the money’s in the slots. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhich, in this case, are the small- and mid-sized businesses that make up the vast majority of Facebook’s 8 million advertisers. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“It would likely take tens of thousands of them, acting over a significant period of time, to put a big dent in Facebook's bottom line,” CNN \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/26/tech/facebook-boycott/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe boycott runs through July, the start of Q3, so we won’t know the financial impact until later this year. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F06%2F28%2Fstarbucks-pauses-ads-social-media\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
